column4: thats a big flaw, if you make the software center smaller, you dont have a horizontal bar
in the software center?
yeah i made the window smaller and couldnt see the search square, i didnt have a horizontal bar
the only somewhat stable way I've found so far is using ubuntu-tweak
you could file a bug about it :)
http://ubuntu-tweak.com/ their project is hosted in Launchpad as well.
ok but im wondering what does ubuntu tweak has?
it lets you use themes you can find in the repos.
thanks im goign to look into it but for now im going to fix my video drivers
alrighty.
ubuntu-tweak will allow you to use other themes. http://ubuntu-tweak.com/
zankz! Ill look through it
it has lots other good features too :)
i have that doesnt include back doors o.O
huh?
you think ubuntu tweak will slow down my gaming? is it like compiz?
no, it doesn't run in the background
it simply gives you easy access to certain features that are readily available in the default configuration tools.
thanks, thats the only reason i didnt go to compiz, because it worked a little flaky when i gamed
not bad, ubuntu tweak did the trick but i'm almost there, ubuntu now is in a usable state but I want how do I download more themes? o.O
either from the software manager, apt-get or aptitude, synaptic. Whatever package manager you prefer. Search for themes.
